short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: A Chrome Extension of a Favorite with Privacy Protection Capability

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Use the PrivateFavorites browser plug-in.

Invisible access: PrivateFavorites automatically cleans the browsing history and cookie information within the website or folder group you specify to ensure the privacy and security of your visit.

Hide bookmarks: Hide your bookmarks and folders with one click. You only need to enter the password in the settings to control whether they are visible.

Export lock: Your bookmark records can only be exported after entering a password to enable the export function, ensuring the security and privacy of your backup.

Encrypted export: You can set a password to encrypt the exported bookmark records to ensure that others cannot import your records, thereby protecting your privacy.

Safer search: When the bookmarks or folders you set are not visible, related content cannot be retrieved through the plug-in search function, further enhancing privacy protection.

Incognito mode plug-in support: Incognito mode is provided in the plug-in details to facilitate you to use your bookmarks in private browsing mode.

By using PrivateFavorites, you will have a more secure and private web browsing experience. Whether it is protecting personal privacy or confidential company information, PrivateFavorites is your preferred solution.

Using PrivateFavorites, you can achieve better privacy protection and higher data security, making your work and study more efficient and enjoyable.

使用PrivateFavorites浏览器插件。

无痕访问：PrivateFavorites自动清理您指定的网站或文件夹分组内的浏览历史记录和cookie信息，保证您的访问隐私安全。

隐藏书签：一键隐藏您的书签及文件夹，只需在设置中输入密码后，即可控制是否可见。

导出锁定：仅在输入密码开启导出功能后，才能导出您的书签记录，确保备份的安全和隐私。

加密导出：您可以设置密码对导出的书签记录进行加密，确保他人无法导入您的记录，从而保护您的隐私。

更安全的搜索：当您设置的书签或文件夹不可见时，通过插件搜索功能无法检索相关内容，进一步增强隐私保护。

无痕模式插件支持：插件详情中提供了无痕模式，方便您在无痕浏览模式下使用您的书签。

通过使用PrivateFavorites，您将获得更加安全和私密的网络浏览体验。不论是保护个人隐私还是公司机密信息，PrivateFavorites都是您的首选解决方案。

使用PrivateFavorites，您可实现更好的隐私保护、更高的数据安全，让您的工作和学习更加高效和畅快。
